metadata.name: H2WW Itten Color Psychology System
metadata.description: Johannes Itten's color theory applied to AI learning psychology
metadata.philosophy: Colors as emotional guides through AI mastery journey
metadata.scientificBasis: Bauhaus color theory + modern learning psychology
metadata.application: Emotional architecture for trust building and skill development

red.psychologicalEffect: Activates attention, creates urgency for learning
red.aiContext: Breaking AI barriers, overcoming initial fear

yellow.userState: Engaged learner, ready to explore possibilities

blue.userState: Confident practitioner, ready to guide others

white.function: Clean slate for learning, reduces cognitive load

Primary CTAs, error states, urgent actions, achievement unlocks
Progress indicators, new content highlights, discovery moments
Brand elements, navigation, completed states, reliable actions
Success states, safe practices, ethical guidelines, positive feedback
Use red sparingly, with reassuring context
Colors should match user's current learning phase and emotional state
Introduce complex colors as user confidence grows
Use complementary colors to create visual tension and interest
Limit active colors to reduce mental overhead during learning
